clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Evaluation of Platelet Rich Fibrin Matrix (PRFM) for the Correction of Nasolabial Folds
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Evaluation of Platelet Rich Fibrin Matrix (PRFM) for the Correction of Nasolabial Folds

lead_sponsor.agency: The New York Eye & Ear Infirmary

clinical_study.source: The New York Eye & Ear Infirmary

brief_summary.textblock: Platelets are a component of blood, which contain factors which can enhance wound healing. This study proposes to evaluate the clinical response of laugh lines treated with a concentrated preparation of the subject's own platelets injected into or under the skin by taking serial photographs of the subject's face over a 12 week period. Also, the same preparation will be injected into or under the skin of the arm near the elbows, and serial biopsies will be taken over a 12 week period.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Wrinkle Assessment Score, Between Pre-treatment and 12 Weeks Post-treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Difference in Measurements taken Pre-treatment and 12 weeks after treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Difference in wrinkle assessment score, values ranging from 0 (least noticeable) to 5 ( most noticeable) (scores on a scale)between pre-treatment and 12 weeks post-treatment.

intervention.description: 0-2 cc of autologous platelet rich fibrin matrix injected intra and subdermally to effect nasolabial fold.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy adults
- aged 25- 75 years
- with moderate to severe nasolabial folds
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant
- allergy to local anesthetics
- history of bleeding disorder
- active infection at the treatment site
- injectable filler in the nasolabial folds within past year
